bug.short_desc: Date Picker: Add sync of user input date to the calendar

long_desc.thetext:
If the date picker is set to 'readonly:false' mode the user is able to input his own data into the input field connected with the date picker.
If the user enters a valid date string the calendar should be synced with this date. So if the user is opening the calendar this date should be selected.
If the entered date is a date which is not selectable by the calendar, because the calendar is e.g. setup to only selections on week days and the entered day is a weekend day the sync is *not* performed. Otherwise we will get a dirty state of the calendar.
It is up to the application developer to do a final check.

== Update == Providing a validator configuration is a better idea to get the application developers in control whether the calendar should be updated or not.
As default this validator function is always returning 'true' - no validation is done.

Yet another issue: getting the correct date into the component is another topic. We cannot rely on the native JS Date implementation, because a "01.12.2014" (german date format) is parsed to 12. January 2014 - which is not desired.
So, at least there has to be an option to define the date format for parsing to keep the date picker component clean here.
